Calibration of joint Family-Wise error rate thresholds

Calibration of a family of thresholds that provide joint FWER control

jointFWERControl(mat, refFamily = c("Simes", "kFWER"), alpha, stat = NULL,
  maxStepsDown = 100, kMax = nrow(mat), Rcpp = TRUE, verbose = TRUE)

Arguments

mat

A \(m\) x \(B\) matrix of Monte-Carlo samples of test statistics under the null hypothesis.

m

is the number of tested hypotheses

B

is the number of Monte-Carlo samples
refFamily

A character value which can be

Simes

The classical family of thresholds introduced by Simes (1986): \(\alpha*k/m\). This family yields joint FWER control if the test statistics are positively dependent (PRDS) under H0.

kFWER

A family \((t_k)\) calibrated so that for each k, \((t_k)\) controls the (marginal) k-FWER.
alpha

Target joint FWER level.
stat

A vector of \(m\) test statistics. Not used for single step control, and mandatory for step-down JFWER control. If not provided, single step control is performed.
maxStepsDown

Maximum number of steps down to be performed. maxSteps=1 corresponds to single step JFWER control.
kMax

For simultaneous control of (\(k\)-FWER for all \(k \le k[max]\)).
Rcpp

If TRUE, some costly operations (sorting) are performed in C++.
verbose

A boolean value: should extra info be printed?

Value

A list with elements:

thr

A numeric vector of length m, such that the estimated probability that there exists an index \(k\) between 1 and m such that the k-th maximum of the test statistics of is greater than \(thr[k]\), is less than \(\alpha\).

pivStat

A numeric vector of length m, the values of the pivotal statistic whose quantile of order \(alpha\) is \(lambda\).

lambda

JFWER threshold.

Vbar

An upper bound on the number of false discoveries, as calculated by upperBoundFP(stat, thr).

steps

a list with elements named 'thr', 'pivStat' and 'lambda' giving the sequence of corresponding vectors/values along the steps down.

Examples


set.seed(0xBEEF)
m <- 123
rho <- 0.2
n <- 100
pi0 <- 0.5
B <- 1e3

sim <- simulateEqui(m, rho, B, pi0, SNR=3)
X0 <- sim$X0
x <- sim$x

## Test statistics
pch <- 20
plot(x, col=1+sim$H, main="Test statistics", pch=pch)
legend("topleft", c("H0", "H1"), pch=pch, col=1:2)

alpha <- 0.1
res <- jointFWERControl(X0, refFamily="kFWER", alpha=alpha, stat=x)
#> [1] "Joint Family-Wise Error Rate control: Step down procedure based on kFWER family"
Vbar <- res$Vbar
ttl <- paste("Upper bound on the number of false positives", "among first k hypotheses", sep="\n")
plot(Vbar, main=ttl, xlab="k", ylab=expression(bar(V(k))))
